name: Provision of  Technical Assistance and Training Activities to Assure Comprehensive Cancer Control Outcomes.
objective: The purpose of this program is to fund recipients with proven capacities and expertise in chronic disease prevention and health promotion to provide technical assistance and training to National Comprehensive Cancer Control Program recipients and their coalitions to implement evidence-based and promising comprehensive cancer control interventions in the areas of primary prevention, screening and survivorship.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: This program is authorized under sections 301(a), 317(k)(2) of the Public Health Service Act, [42 U.S.C. 241(a) and 247b(k)(2), as amended.

rules_regulations: Successful applicants must comply with the administrative requirements outlined in 45 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 75.
